name: Rasgulla
description: A popular Bengali dessert made from chhena (Indian cottage cheese) and semolina dough, cooked in a light syrup made of sugar. These soft and spongy balls are a delightful treat.

name: Mishti Doi
description: A traditional Bengali sweet yogurt made by fermenting thickened milk and sugar, often flavored with cardamom. It's creamy, smooth, and has a unique caramelized taste.

name: Cham Cham
description: A delectable Bengali sweet made from chhena (Indian cottage cheese) and cooked in sugar syrup, often garnished with coconut flakes or mawa (dried milk). It's moist and flavorful.

name: Pati Shapta
description: A traditional Bengali crepe filled with a mixture of coconut, jaggery, and khoya (dried milk). These sweet, soft, and delicious crepes are often enjoyed during festivals.
